body_html:
I think a separate repo could be good, especially if it had a requirements.txt with an explicit version of tensorflow they were written against will also be a big win.

Note that keeping the outputs in place has two big advantages:

  1. github does a great job displaying them (yay nbviewer)
  2. Makes it possible to write tests (at least internally)

I think end-users will benefit a lot from (1).

body:
I think a separate repo could be good, especially if it had a `requirements.txt` with an explicit version of tensorflow they were written against will also be a big win.

Note that keeping the outputs in place has two big advantages:
1. github does a great job displaying them (yay nbviewer)
2. Makes it possible to write tests (at least internally)

I think end-users will benefit a lot from (1).
